result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Ct 3 but Concurrent to any other sentence defendant is serving

superMiscConds.notes: Fulltime employment/schooling of at least 30 hours per week and if not, then perform 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.
No contact with A.W.
No possession of dangerous weapons.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.

COURT ORDERS sentences to start today.

Case Called: 8:49 am 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall by Zoom Video; Deft appears by Zoom Video from Lincoln County Jail, pro se. 
Date and time set for hrg on deft's request for early release. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT questions deft re: status of incarceration. 
Deft is awaiting transfer to prison from Lincoln County Jail. 
State takes no position on deft's request. 
COURT questions deft if this is a reincarceration. 
Deft confirms this is a reincarceration. 
COURT suggests deft file petition for sentence adjustment as that seems to be correct mechanism to address deft's requests. 
Deft notes concerns with not having proper time in before filing petition for sentence adjustment. 
COURT advises deft will be allowed to withdraw petition for sentence adjustment if proper time is not yet served, so deft may refile at appropriate time. 
COURT denies motion as written. 
Adj: 8:59 am
from Defendant re: sentence credit/petition for sentence adjustment- stj

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: 1-SEALED & 2

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:37 pm 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan. 
Parties have received copies of PSI. No additions/corrections to PSI. VRCW. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 3 years ES - to run consecutive to sentence on Ct. 3. 
                           : On Ct. 3>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - to run consecutive to sentence on Ct. 1. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/schooling of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no contact with A.W; DNA sample; No possession of dangerous weapons; court costs including to DA surcharges. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to start today and concurrent to any other sentence deft is serving. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 221 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT advises Atty Morgan to review with deft and submit notice of right to seek postconviction relief. 
OTR: 3:52 pm BOTR: 3:58 pm 
COURT allows counsel to retain copies of PSI and advises parties to maintain their confidentiality. 
COURT remands deft into custody. 
Adj: 3:59 pm
of Motion hearing on 3-12-2015

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:18am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Andrew Morgan

State notes sentencing set for 7/23, but motions filed pro se by defendant in between representation by counsel, which is reason for hearing today.
COURT notes motions for suppression, bond modification and discovery  filed by defendant pro se.
Atty Morgan notes discovery given to defendant on discovery issue; Motion to Suppress is addressed -- State objects as it is not timely, COURT denies Motion to Suppress.; Motion for bond modification addressed -- Argument by Attorney Morgan, COURT notes defendant has been found guilty and awaiting sentencing and that there is no right to bail after conviction and denies Motion for bond modification.

COURT questions if Attorney Morgan if they will be ready for sentencing on 7/23/15 - Atty Morgan states he will be ready on that date.
Attorney Morgan requesting to revisit motion to withdraw plea - COURT notes that issue was already ruled upon; Attorney Morgan states he will still likely be filing motion on that issue.
COURT leaves sentencing date on calendar.

Adj: 10:26am

Case Called: 3:37 pm 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Pauline Toulouse. 

STATE'S MOTION TO AMEND INFORMATION. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. COURT grants. 

ARRAIGNMENT ON AMENDED INFORMATION. 
Reading Waived. Plea: Not Guilty. 

STATE'S MOTION RE: CHILD ADVOCACY CENTER VIDEO. 
Argument. Atty Toulouse makes statement.  Atty Toulouse withdraws motion in objection to introduction of videotaped statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling - will admit video with redactions as stated on the record. 

DEFENSE'S MOTIONS IN LIMINE. 
#1 - Granted. #2 - Granted. #3 - Granted. #4 - COURT gives ruling. #5 - Denied. #6 - COURT finds unnecessary - witness will not be called as expert. #7 - Denied. #8 - Held in Abeyance. #9 - Granted. #10 - Granted. Atty Pauline moves for exclusion of T.M. as witness. COURT notes no written motion filed re: exclusion of T.M. #11 - Granted. #12 - Granted. #13 - Granted. #14 - COURT gives ruling. #15 - Granted. #16 - Granted - COURT orders sequestration of witness. #17 - Granted. #18 - Granted as stated on the record. #19 - COURT notes this motion is better addressed during trial. #20 - COURT gives ruling. #22 Granted. #23 - Granted. #24. Granted. #25 Granted. 

STATE'S MOTIONS IN LIMINE. 
#1 - Granted. #2 - Granted. #3 - Granted. #4 - Granted. #5 - Granted. #6 - COURT does not address at this time as it does not appear to be relevant. #7 - COURT will address morning of trial. #8 - Granted. #9 - Granted. #10 - Granted as stated on the record. #11 - Granted. #12 - Withdrawn by the State. #13 - Granted. 

COURT addresses counsel regarding handling of objections during trial. COURT notes it is preparing statement of the case. COURT indicates it will give opening instruction to jury and will provide copies to counsel prior to voir dire. COURT notes there will be no alternates. COURT advises parties to be present at 8:30 am tomorrow morning. 

Atty Toulouse requests ruling regarding number of deft's prior convictions. 
COURT makes findings. COURT gives ruling. 

Atty Toulouse notes intent to introduce powerpoint slides during trial including during voir dire.
